channel.title: cmdtest on Alvin Sim
channel.description: Recent content in cmdtest on Alvin Sim

item.title: Which 'yarn'?
item.description: This has happened to me each time I setup a new Debian or Ubuntu environment. Firstly, the yarn command I am referring to here is the JavaScript “Yarn” package manager. The yarn that was installed or already installed was the one used by the cmdtest. I thought I had yarn installed when I checked using the command which yarn and out printed /usr/bin/yarn. $ which yarn /usr/bin/yarn When I ran yarn upgrade I got this weird error message:
